body.p: Mark Utting (Waikato University): Architect and administrator of the CZT project on Sourceforge. Designer of the Z font used in the jEdit CZT plugin. Currently writing a Z-to-B translator to connect Z to the various B refinement, proof and test generation tools, such as the Leirios Test Generator, and rewriting the Jaza animator in Java (the new animator is called ZLive).

Petra Malik (Waikato University): Developer of the 'gnast' code generator (which generates Java classes and visitors from XML schema files), most of the core CZT framework, the LaTeX and Unicode scanners and printers, the JEdit plugins and the CZT website based on forrest. Petra also manages releases, integration testing and support.
Tim Miller (University of Queensland, now University of Liverpool): Developer of the Z and OZ parser and typechecker.
Leonardo Freitas (York University): Developer of the Circus tools.
Andrew Martin (Oxford University): Instigator of the CZT project (October 2001).
Ian Toyn (York University): Editor of the ISO Z standard and designer of the XML DTD for Z.
DONG Jin Song (National University of Singapore): Supervisor of several projects on XML tools for TCOZ (Timed Communicating Object Z).
SUN Jing (Auckland University): His PhD thesis, Tools and Verification Techniques for Integrated Formal Methods, explored the use of XML for Z and TCOZ.
CHEN Chunqing (National University of Singapore): Developer of an early version of the Z parser.
LI Yuan Fang (National University of Singapore): Developer of an extended XML schema for TCOZ and an early version of the typechecker for Z and TCOZ.
Nick Daley (Waikato University): Developer of the 'Gaffe' GUI-builder for Z animators.
Gerret Apelt (Waikato University): Developer of the ZML-to-HTML translator for viewing and browsing Z.
Rohit Bansal (Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi): Helped start the development of ZLive, the new Z animation tool.
Chengdong Xu (Waikato University): Developer of the eclipse plugin.
Linan (Waikato University): Improves the 'Gaffe' GUI-builder started by Nick.
